thread.title: Must-see sports this week: High school football finale, Cubs in NLCS
thread.title_full: Must-see sports this week: High school football finale, Cubs in NLCS

title: Must-see sports this week: High school football finale, Cubs in NLCS
text: Posted Oct. 18, 2015 at 8:00 AM Posted Oct. 18, 2015 at 8:00 AM Holland, Mich. 1. Prep football Week 9 7 p.m. Friday The high school football regular season ends with a bang this week with some rivalries and teams looking to clinch playoff spots. Zeeland East hosts Muskegon Reeths-Puffer with a playoff spot on the line and Zeeland West plays at Hudsonville Unity Christian with a chance to clinch the outright OK Green title. In rivalry action, Saugatuck hosts Fennville, Hamilton hosts Holland Christian and Grand Haven hosts West Ottawa. Holland will host Byron Center to close out the season. 2. MLB playoffs All week on Fox and TBS Will the Cubs finally make it back to the World Series? If so, who will they face? Find out this week with the National League and American League championship series. The Cubs will play Game 2 at 8 p.m. Monday on TBS with games Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday at 8 p.m. and Saturday and Sunday if necessary on TBS. Kansas City will face Toronto in the ALCS on Monday at 8 p.m. , Tuesday at 4 p.m., Wednesday at 4 p.m. and Friday and Saturday at 8 p.m. 3. District soccer All week The postseason begins for the high school boys soccer teams this week with the one-and-done state tournament, beginning with districts. On Monday, Fennville hosts Buchanan at 6 p.m., while Black River and Holland Calvary play a doubleheader at Grandville Calvin Christian beginning at 4:30 p.m. On Tuesday, West Ottawa hosts Muskegon Reeths-Puffer at 6 p.m., Holland hosts Zeeland West at 6 p.m. and Zeeland East hosts Holland Christian at 6 p.m. Hamilton plays at Middleville at 7 p.m. 4. GVSU homecoming 7 p.m. Saturday at Lubbers Stadium The Grand Valley State football team will play its homecoming game on Saturday with plenty on the line. The Lakers host Michigan Tech and look to improve on their 5-1 record. GVSU can remain in the hunt for a GLIAC title with a win at 7 p.m. at Lubbers Stadium. It is a “white out” theme and will be on XFinity 900. 5. Cross country conference Wednesday at Helder park The OK Green cross country conference meet is this week and is perhaps the most highly anticipated in the sport’s history. Zeeland West, Hamilton and Holland have a chance to win the boys meet, while Hamilton, Holland Christian, Holland and Zeeland West all have a shot at the girls meet. And who will win the individual races? Hamilton’s Erika and Mark Freyhof? Holland’s Sam Martens and Jordyn Elders? Zeeland West’s Jarek Brower and Haley Hoogenraad? Or maybe Holland Christian’s Kayla Windemuller? Should be exciting. — Dan D’Addona
